Endurance athletes and older individuals with osteoporosis are at risk for developing these types of stress fractures. A history of a previous stress fracture and female sex are 2 well known risk factors for stress fractures in endurance athletes.22 The female athlete triad of low energy availability, menstrual dysfunction, and low bone mineral density can also disrupt normal osteoclastic and osteoblastic processes.
